meanings.definition: Resistant to the growth or spread of germs.
meanings.sent1: The hospital used germproof curtains to prevent the spread of infections.
meanings.sent2: She wore germproof gloves while cleaning to keep her hands safe from bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The germproof phone case was so effective, it even kept the flu away!
meanings.sent4: His immune system was like a germproof shield, protecting him from illnesses.
meanings.sent5: The germproof coating on the doorknob made it shine and kept it clean.

meanings.definition: To make something resistant to germs.
meanings.sent1: She germproofed her kitchen by using a strong disinfectant.
meanings.sent2: The scientist germproofed the lab equipment to ensure a sterile environment.
meanings.sent3: He germproofed his hands before cooking to avoid contaminating the food.
meanings.sent4: The cleaning crew germproofed the entire office building overnight.
meanings.sent5: The mother germproofed her child's toys by washing them regularly.
